alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Chatham; Guilford; Orange; Person; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 7:56AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Chatham, Guilford, Orange, Person and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 756 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burlington, Asheboro, Graham, Roxboro, Hillsborough, Siler City, North Carolina Zoo, Mebane, Seagrove, Concord, Liberty, Haw River, Ramseur, Franklinville, Swepsonville, Alamance, Staley, Saxapahaw, Sutphin and Snow Camp. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Alamance; Chatham; Guilford; Orange; Person; Randolph
